intro: Ogcodeia inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal ogcodeia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Ogcodeia inaequalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
